JobPositionInformation.PositionTitle: Assistant / Associate Professor Position in Industry 4.0 / Digital Manufacturing for the Renewable Energy Sector
JobPositionInformation.Purpose:
SDU Engineering Operations Management at the Department of Technology and Innovation (ITI), University of Southern Denmark (SDU), invites applications for a position as Assistant or Associate Professor in Industry 4.0 / Digital Manufacturing Operations for the Renewable Energy Sector.

Job description 
The successful candidate will drive internationally competitive research, collaborate across disciplines, work closely with industry and attract competitive external research and innovation funding. The candidate will play a key role in providing outstanding education, supervise students and develop junior research staff. 

We offer
We offer a vigorous international research environment with a balance of male and female researchers, excellent facilities, including the Industry 4.0 Laboratories at University of Southern Denmark, a long-term strategic initiative created to support research, teaching, and industrial collaboration and experimentation. SDU expect to increase its’ collaboration with industrial companies and associations within the Renewable Energy Sector (particularly equipment vendors for the Power-to-X industry) with the purpose of contributing to realization of DK and EU objectives for scalability and low cost of green fuels for industry and transport. The candidate is therefore expected to work on one or more external funded projects addressing digitalization / digital twin and competitive challenges of manufacturing and supply chains of this industry. In addition, the position offers the opportunity to shape our educational programmes to benefit from new developments in research fields, approaches, and content.  

We expect
The candidate must have a relevant PhD.

Commensurate with the seniority of the position applied for, the candidate must have:

  • A solid track record in education and supervision
  • Extensive experience with industrial collaboration
  • An excellent standing in research and innovation
  • Experience from and successes in attracting research funding
  • Industry work and project management experience will be assessed positively
  • Good written and oral communication skills
  • International and team oriented mindset
  • Fluent in English, both spoken and written                     

      The candidate must have experience and competences in several of the following fields:

      • Industry 4.0 & Digital Twin frameworks and applications
      • Industrial Automation and Control
      • Sensors, IOT and Systems integration
      • MES and ERP solutions
      • Applied Robotics
      • Simulation and Virtual Reality of Manufacturing Operations and Logistics
      • Data analysis, BIG data and modelling (AI / Machine Learning)
      • Sustainability of Manufacturing Operations

      Contact information
      Further information about the position can be obtained from Head of Section, Niels Gorm Maly Rytter, phone: +45 29103729 or email: ngry@iti.sdu.dk
        
      Condition of employment  
      The appointment as Associate Professor is permanent while that as Assistant Professor is for an initial period of 3 years. Employment is on the terms specified in the labour market agreement in effect for SDU.    For information about working in Denmark please, follow this link https://www.sdu.dk/en/iso.

      The starting date is August 2022 or as soon here after, and the job location is at Odense Denmark.

      Application, salary etc.
      The successful applicant will be employed in accordance with the agreement between the Ministry of Finance and AC (the Danish Confederation of Professional Associations). Please check links for more information on salary and taxation.

      The application must include the following:

      1. Letter of motivation, including details on qualifications within the subject area (max. one page).
      2. A curriculum vitae including information on previous employment, list of programming skills mastered by the applicant, and teaching and supervision experience.
      3. A certified copy of your PhD degree certificate.
      4. A full list of publications stating the scientific publications on which the applicant wishes to rel
      5. At least one letter of recommendation from supervisors or previous employers. Should your referees wish to send their letters directly to us, please have them use e-mail:ngry@iti.sdu.dk mentioning your name and the title of the position in the subject line. Please note that these also need to reach us before deadline.

      Shortlisting may be used in the assessment process.

      Incomplete applications and applications received after the deadline will neither be considered nor evaluated.

      Important information before applying
      Applications will be assessed by an expert assessor/committee. Applicants will be informed of their assessment by the university.

      The University wishes our staff to reflect the diversity of society and thus welcomes applications from all qualified candidates regardless of personal background.

      Applications must be submitted electronically using the link "Apply online". Attached files must be in Adobe PDF or Word format. Each box can only contain a single file of max. 10 Mb. We strongly recommend that you read How to apply before you apply.

      Further information for international applicants about entering and working in Denmark.
